testcase.name: SecureCredentialManager > Singleton Pattern > should return the same instance
SecureCredentialManager > Environment Variable Fallback > should get credential from environment variable when secure storage unavailable
SecureCredentialManager > Environment Variable Fallback > should set credential in environment variable when secure storage unavailable
SecureCredentialManager > Environment Variable Fallback > should delete credential from environment variable
SecureCredentialManager > Environment Variable Fallback > should return null for non-existent credential
SecureCredentialManager > macOS Keychain Storage > should detect macOS keychain availability
SecureCredentialManager > macOS Keychain Storage > should get credential from keychain
SecureCredentialManager > macOS Keychain Storage > should set credential in keychain
SecureCredentialManager > macOS Keychain Storage > should delete credential from keychain
SecureCredentialManager > macOS Keychain Storage > should fallback to environment variable if keychain fails
SecureCredentialManager > macOS Keychain Storage > should return correct storage type
SecureCredentialManager > Windows Credential Manager Storage > should detect Windows credential manager availability
SecureCredentialManager > Windows Credential Manager Storage > should set credential in Windows credential manager
SecureCredentialManager > Windows Credential Manager Storage > should delete credential from Windows credential manager
SecureCredentialManager > Windows Credential Manager Storage > should return correct storage type
SecureCredentialManager > Linux Secret Service Storage > should detect Linux secret service availability
SecureCredentialManager > Linux Secret Service Storage > should get credential from secret service
SecureCredentialManager > Linux Secret Service Storage > should set credential in secret service
SecureCredentialManager > Linux Secret Service Storage > should delete credential from secret service
SecureCredentialManager > Linux Secret Service Storage > should return correct storage type
SecureCredentialManager > Migration from Environment Variables > should migrate credential from environment to secure storage
SecureCredentialManager > Migration from Environment Variables > should not migrate if no environment variable exists
SecureCredentialManager > Migration from Environment Variables > should keep environment variable if secure storage fails
SecureCredentialManager > Error Handling > should handle unavailable secure storage gracefully
SecureCredentialManager > Error Handling > should fallback to environment variables when secure storage operations fail
SecureCredentialManager > Error Handling > should not throw when deleting non-existent credentials
SecureCredentialManager > Security Considerations > should not log credential values in commands
SecureCredentialManager > Security Considerations > should handle special characters in credentials safely
SecureCredentialManager > Security Considerations > should use stdio pipes to prevent credential exposure
SecureCredentialManager > Integration with Global Instance > should export a singleton instance
